definition: strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort

sentences.english: Better to be despised and have a servant, than to be self—important and lack food.
sentences.chinese: 被人轻贱，却有仆人，强如自尊，缺少食物。

sentences.english: It is better to heed a wise man's rebuke than to listen to the song of fool*.
sentences.chinese: 听智慧人的责备，强如听愚昧人的歌唱。

sentences.english: It is better to heed a wise man's rebuke than to listen to the song of fools.
sentences.chinese: 听智慧人的责备，强如听愚昧人的歌唱。

sentences.english: Better one handful with tranquillity than two handfuls with toil and chasing after the wind.
sentences.chinese: 满了一把，得享安静，强如两把齐抓，劳碌捕风。

sentences.english: Open rebuke is better than secret love.
sentences.chinese: 当面的责备，强如背地的爱情。

sentences.english: Rebuke is more effective for a wise man than a hundred blows on a fool.
sentences.chinese: 一句责备话入聪明人的心，强如责打愚昧人一百下。

sentences.english: It is better to hear the rebuke of the wise, than for a man to hear the song of fools.
sentences.chinese: 听智慧人的责备，强如听愚昧人的歌唱。

sentences.english: Better to be lowly in spirit and among the oppressed than to share plunder with the proud.
sentences.chinese: 心里谦卑与穷乏人来往，强如将掠物与骄傲人同分。

sentences.english: Remember that it is better to walk in the dark with God than to walk alone in the light. --The Still Small Voice.
sentences.chinese: 请记得在黑暗中与神同在，强如在光明中单独行走。

definition: to shake up/to deal a shock/(fig.) to stir (sb's heart)
to be equal to/to be well-matched/rival
to beat comfortably/to win easily/abbr. for 穩操勝券|稳操胜券, to have victory within one's grasp
were it not for/if not for
Second Sage, traditional title of Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] in Confucian studies
let alone/to say nothing of/besides/what's more
opponent/substantial adversary/worthy match/antagonist/in the enemy's hands
to escape unscathed/to get through in one piece
to resist/to hold back/to stop/to ward off/to withstand
